intro: Phlomoides vicaryi, commonly known as the Victoria's phlomoides, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, tubular flowers that are typically pale blue or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grassland habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare species with specific ecological requirements.
